page.title: 18TOURISM WINTERBOURNE VALLEY
page.content: Many summer visitors drive through this area to enjoy the scenic views. Most visit Hardy's Monument which was built in 1844 as a viewpoint in memory of Admiral Thomas Hardy who had lived in Portesham nearby.The monument is no longer safe enough to climb but a very extensive panorama stretches in every direction and can be viewed from the unfenced car park at its base.The land owner provides this and makes no charge. A caravan provides light refreshments there in summer. Many tourists park their cars and use footpaths and bridleways which are clearly signposted for walking and horseriding. The South-West Coastal Path which runs along the Ridgeway is much used, especially from Smitten Corner. Several houses provide bed and breakfast accommodation.
